text: Kyle Jean-Baptiste (December 3, 1993 – August 28, 2015) was an American Broadway actor. He was the youngest actor ever to play the role of Jean Valjean in Les Misérables on Broadway. He was also the first African-American to play that role on Broadway. Jean-Baptiste died at age 21, after falling off a fire escape staircase at his mother's home in New York City. ==References== Category:1993 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Accidental deaths from falls in the United States Category:Accidental deaths in New York City Category:Actors from New York (state) Category:African-American actors Category:American stage actors
title: Kyle Jean-Baptiste
